Articles.Content: in its default config what will these launchers work with (2x 3.2x 6.4x or RO)?

> 
> 
> 9 minutes ago, popeter45 said:
> 
> 
> in its default config what will these launchers work with (2x 3.2x 6.4x or RO)?
> 

By default they will be configured for RSS only. How I've up the mod to work is; there are multiple config files in a separate folder that are set to only "activate" if you have certain mods installed. For instance,if you have RO installed, the RO configs that comes with the mod will automatically detect RO and use the RO configs. If you only play in RSS with RealFuels without RO, the mod will only use the RealFuels configs. If you have RealPlume and Smokescreen installed, the mod will detect these and use the RealPlume and Smokescreen configs that comes with this mod and so on.

If you don't use RSS, RO, RealFuels, RealPlume, Remote Tech etc, there will be another set of configs available (Thanks to Kartoffelkuchen) that can replace the default configs and set up all the launchers for either Stock or 6.4x. If someone makes configs for 2x and 3.2x, I'll add these configs to the mod as well. The configs for stock, 2x, 3.2x and 6.4x will need to manually replace the default configs, whilst the configs for RO, RP, RF, RT etc are already set up to auto-activate if they detect any of these mods.

Doing it this way should make life a lot easier for anyone who installs this mod ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") Basically all you'll have to do (once the mod is re-released) is to paste the "Liquidhype" folder into your GameData directory. I'll post a whole "How to install" section in the OP once I start releasing the launchers.

Impossible to say, it depends on when 1.1 hits really. I'll release anything once it is ready for release. Standard Vega, and Delta III are both ready, but I want to bundle Vega into a "Vega pack" which will include all the parts and stages necessary to make Vega-C, Vega-E and Vega-E2, and all those parts are not completely textured yet. I also want to make some slight changes to Delta III, even though it looks really good now.

As for Ariane 6, I'm completely removing the PPH configuration, and changing the current A62 and A64 configuration from [this](http://www.esa.int/var/esa/storage/images/esa_multimedia/images/2014/12/artist_s_view_of_the_two_configurations_of_ariane_6/15091925-2-eng-GB/Artist_s_view_of_the_two_configurations_of_Ariane_6_node_full_image_2.jpg) to [this](http://www.esa.int/var/esa/storage/images/esa_multimedia/images/2015/11/artist_s_view_of_the_two_configurations_of_ariane_62/15684690-1-eng-GB/Artist_s_view_of_the_two_configurations_of_Ariane_6_node_full_image_2.jpg). I'm done modeling the new Ariane 6, but most parts needs textures and being run through Unity.
So the Vega E and E2 have upper stages powered by the Aestus 2 and LM10 (RD0146) engines instead of the Z9 and Avum, right?

Oh right. Well none of the engines in my Sketchfab model are the actual engines. They are all made in other .blend files and I'll upload those as well once they are textured.

I've made all the engines for Soyuz as actual engines, and not as parts of the stages themselves. So the engines I've made are the RD-108A, RD-107A, RD-0110, RD-0124 and the S5.92 engine. I might remove the vernier engines on RD-108A/RD107A and have them attach separately as individual engines. I've not decided yet.

In addition to Soyuz itself and its engines, I've made 3 different payload adapters and 2 payload dispensers. As I mentioned in my previous post, Soyuz will also have 3 versions of the Fregat upper stage to choose from.

I am glad to hear you are excited. That gives me even more motivation to finish up this project.

I've been keeping most of the development secret because I don't need people asking for progress reports every other day. But the mod is really shaping up nicely. Every single individual launch vehicle that is going into this mod is modeled, at least more or less. For example Soyuz-5 and GSLV-Mk3 still needs a few things modeled. Other than that, everything is modeled, most things are textured and quite a few of the launch vehicles are already in the game and working. I am "secrely" working on a couple of small things that i <u>might</u> add to the mod, such as Stratolaunch and the 2 known concepts for LauncherOne. My main focus however is on the launch vehicles listed in the OP.

Just a quick shoutout to Dragon01. Dragon has been amazingly helpfull during the development process.

Did you make the Fregat-SB? It's the one with the drop tank. I've modeled something like that before but it remains untextured.

If you need any help feel free to ask me!
